long: Meaning: to "stop" (usually over night); by implication, to "stay permanently"; hence (in a bad sense) to "be obstinate" (especially in words, to complain).  Usage: abide (all night), continue, dwell, endure, grudge, be left, sleep/lie all night, (cause to) lodge (all night, in, -ing, this night), (make to) murmur, remain, tarry (all night, that night).  Source: or "לִין"; a primitive root;
